result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:52am 
Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax appears by Zoom videoconference. Attorney Joseph Dorlack appears by Zoom videoconference.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that Mr. Pax can see the proceedings through the Zoom video-connection. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Dorlack requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing. The Defense will be able to appear in person for the hearing.  
recess 11:56am.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on December 8th at 8:30am
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:10 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax appeared by phone.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack appeared by video for Mitchell Allen Pax.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
By agreement, the Court finds the video appearance to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies the DOB and address information of the defendant. 
Statement as to case status presented by Atty. Dorlack. 
Case continued for STC - 10/24/22 at 11am by Zoom. 
Recess 2:13pm

Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack appeared by video for Mitchell Allen Pax.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa A Beck in court in-person and by Zoom for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Dorlack indicates that discussions are ongoing - noting that the defendant pending Waukesha cases are scheduled for Dispo. Hrg. in early October. 
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:52am 
 Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax in court.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack in court for Mitchell Allen Pax.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:55am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/7/22 at 3:40pm    (2) Status Conference on 9/20/22 at 2:00pm via zoom

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 8:53am 
Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax appears by audio-only. Attorney Joseph Dorlack appears. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Dorlack indicates that the Defense is requesting that the Court proceed with the hearing with Mr. Pax appearing by audio only.  
The Court finds that the Zoom connection is sufficient.  
Officer N. Achilli- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Dorlack
 
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Pax committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
The Court indicates that arraignment will be scheduled on a later date, with Mr. Pax required to appear in person. 
In response to the Court's inquiry, Mr. Pax indicates that his mailing address is: 512 N. Grandview Blvd, Waukesha.
recess 9:14am 

NEXT:  Arraignment on July 29th at 8:30am with in-person appearances

Order to Seal Victim Key

[ma] Case called at 2:18 PM [Court Reporter: Rose Roderick]
Defendant Mitchell Allen Pax appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD will appoint counsel).  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; updates address to: 512 N. Grandview Blvd., Waukesha 53188
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no intentional contact with Victim 1

recess 2:21 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 6/21/22 at 8:30am
